docs.abstract: CareZone, a start-up created by Jonathan Schwartz, the former chief executive of Sun Microsystems, is a way to organize medical records and plan care for the “biological reality” of caring for a child or parent.
docs.snippet: CareZone, a start-up created by Jonathan Schwartz, the former chief executive of Sun Microsystems, is a way to organize medical records and plan care for the “biological reality” of caring for a child or parent.

docs.abstract: The average deductible for people who get health insurance through their employer has doubled over the past six years, according to an analysis from the Kaiser Family Foundation.
docs.snippet: The average deductible for people who get health insurance through their employer has doubled over the past six years, according to an analysis from the Kaiser Family Foundation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Eliot, who early on served as T.S. Eliot’s secretary, later went on to edit his letters and guard his reputation.

headline.seo: Valerie Eliot, Wife and Editor of T.S. Eliot, Dies at 86
headline.main: Valerie Eliot, Poet’s Wife and Defender, Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Valerie Eliot, Wife and Editor of T. S. Eliot, Dies at 86

docs.abstract: Valerie Eliot, wife of poet TS Eliot who steadfastly guarded his literary legacy for nearly half century, dies at age 86.
docs.snippet: Mrs. Eliot, who early on served as T.S. Eliot’s secretary, later went on to edit his letters and guard his reputation.

docs.lead_paragraph: We’re going down the wrong path. It’s simply not true that we can cut taxes and produce revenue by trimming some of our favorite deductions. It sounds good, but it’s unrealistic.

headline.seo: Deluding Ourselves Over the Fiscal Cliff

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former Treasury secretary Robert E Rubin contends that it is unrealistic to assume that by curbing tax deductions it will be possible to both lower taxes and increase revenue sufficient to address nation's fiscal needs; observes that current moment offers special opportunity to enact budget reform, and asserts that open, clear-eyed debate is needed so that opportunity is not squandered.
docs.snippet: We’re going down the wrong path. It’s simply not true that we can cut taxes and produce revenue by trimming some of our favorite deductions. It sounds good, but it’s unrealistic.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government hopes to avoid the large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the last year, which halted several industrial projects.

headline.seo: China Mandates ‘Social Risk’ Reviews for Big Projects
headline.main: ‘Social Risk’ Test Ordered by China for Big Projects
headline.print_headline: ‘Social Risk’ Test Ordered By China for Big Projects

docs.abstract: Chinese government orders that all major industrial projects must pass 'social risk assessment' before they begin; move is aimed at curtailing large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the past year, which have forced suspension or cancellation of chemical plants, coal-fired power plants and giant copper smelter.
docs.snippet: The government hopes to avoid the large and increasingly violent environmental protests of the last year, which halted several industrial projects.

docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt.

headline.seo: Some Parents, Shouldering Student Loans, Fall on Tough Times
headline.main: Child’s Education, but Parents’ Crushing Loans
headline.print_headline: Child’s Education, but Parents’ Crushing Loans

docs.abstract: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt;  most of them did well enough through midlife to take on sizable loans, but some have since fallen on tough times because of the recession, health problems,  or job losses, and are too ashamed to seek assistance; borrowers age 60 and older are the fastest-growing age group for college debt in the nation (Series: Degrees of Debt).
docs.snippet: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese officials tried to allay concerns on Sunday that the country was allowing its banking system to grow at a reckless pace as a way to sustain short-term economic growth.

headline.seo: China’s Banking Leaders Seek to Calm Concerns Over Lending
headline.main: China’s Banking Leaders Seek to Calm Concerns Over Loan Quality
headline.print_headline: China Tackles Concerns Over Health of Banks

docs.abstract: China's top banking regulators and chairmen of its four largest banks hold news conference to allay concerns that country is allowing its banking system to grow at  reckless pace as way to sustain short-term economic growth; loans in China have been climbing steeply over four years as share of economy, prompting foreign bank analysts to question sustainability of country's economic model.
docs.snippet: Chinese officials tried to allay concerns on Sunday that the country was allowing its banking system to grow at a reckless pace as a way to sustain short-term economic growth.

headline.main: The Culture War and the Jobs Crisis

docs.abstract: Does the Obama coalition have the capacity to re-engineer capitalism to produce sustained economic growth while working toward social justice?
docs.snippet: Does the Obama coalition have the capacity to re-engineer capitalism to produce sustained economic growth while working toward social justice?

docs.lead_paragraph: The threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan. 1 could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems.

headline.seo: Budget Showdown Offers an Opportunity for Progress
headline.main: Budget Showdown Offers an Opportunity for Progress
headline.print_headline: Standing on the Edge of an Opportunity

docs.abstract: Christina D Romer Economic View column contends the threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan 1, 2013, could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems; offers thoughts about situation, and about how Pres Obama and Congress could make progress.
docs.snippet: The threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan. 1 could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: Will they help advance health care reform by setting up insurance exchanges?
docs.abstract: Editorial analyzes why it is good idea for states to set up health insurance exchanges for their residents as required by health care reform law, rather than letting federal government set them up; contends it is good opportunity for Republican governors and legislators who rail against federal intrusion in activities to show they really mean it.
docs.snippet: Will they help advance health care reform by setting up insurance exchanges?
